I think - well, the first point to make is that participants in that economy are domestic Chinese, and they are unable to convert their local currency into overseas currency.
So therefore they cannot invest outside China, and so effectively that stock market is, for all intents and purposes, closed.

It is also true that companies which you would normally expect to be using the stock market as a source of capital on an ongoing basis in fact do not.
